EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.93}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Waste Management and Emissions or the cell corresponding to Oil and Infrastructure?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Oil} and {Infrastructure} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Oil and Investment or the cell corresponding to Renewables and Technology?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Oil} and {Investment} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Electricity and Efficiency or the cell corresponding to Electricity and Emissions?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Electricity} and {Emissions} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.40 to 0.55?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Distribution, Efficiency), (Electricity, Efficiency), (Exploration, Emissions), (Gas, Emissions), (Nuclear, Infrastructure), (Nuclear, Investment), (Nuclear, Policy), (Oil, Policy), (Nuclear, Production), (Nuclear, Reliability), (Gas, Storage), (Nuclear, Storage), (Exploration, Technology), (Gas, Technology)}.
